meanings.sent1: Her writing is known for its concisenesses, always getting straight to the point.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate the concisenesses of his speech, never wasting words.
meanings.sent3: The concisenesses of the recipe made it easy for even beginners to follow.
meanings.sent4: His concisenesses in decision-making saved us a lot of time and confusion.
meanings.sent5: The concisenesses of the map legend made it easy to understand at a glance.

meanings.definition: The state of being brief and to the point.
meanings.sent1: In debates, politicians aim for concisenesses to make their arguments clear.
meanings.sent2: The concisenesses of the meeting agenda allowed us to cover all topics efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The concisenesses of the joke made everyone laugh without dragging it out.
meanings.sent4: Her speech had the concisenesses of a bullet, hitting all the key points swiftly.
meanings.sent5: The concisenesses of the instructions made assembly a breeze.
